humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that one out of 23 lymph nodes is positive for carcinoma (1/23). This corresponds to N1 stage according to the AJCC staging system (New Rule 12: N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes).

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for cancer staging is determined by the presence and extent of lymph node involvement. In this pathology report, it is stated that one out of 23 lymph nodes is positive for carcinoma (1/23). This indicates that the cancer has spread to at least one lymph node, which corresponds to N1 stage. The substaging information, such as the size of the metastasis or the number of positive lymph nodes, is not provided in this report, so only the main N stage can be determined.
